meanings.sent1: I misaimed the ball and it hit the wall instead of the target.
meanings.sent2: She tends to misaim when shooting hoops, but she's improving with practice.
meanings.sent3: During the game, he would misaim on purpose to keep his opponents guessing.
meanings.sent4: Her words misaimed at his heart, causing unintended pain.
meanings.sent5: The archer's misaim resulted in a spectacularly missed shot that surprised everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of aiming incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: His misaim was evident when the arrow landed far from the target.
meanings.sent2: The misaim of the missile led to unintended consequences.
meanings.sent3: The robot's misaim caused chaos in the factory, amusing the workers.
meanings.sent4: Her misaim in the debate made her arguments weak and ineffective.
meanings.sent5: The misaim of the telescope made the stars appear blurry and out of focus.
